summary: The Wildfire Infrastructure and Landowner Tax Relief Act of 2025 (WILTR Act of 2025) aims to incentivize wildfire prevention by amending the Internal Revenue Code. It proposes excluding from gross income grants or awards related to hazardous fuel reduction activities, including fuel breaks, firebreaks, and removal of hazardous fuels. It also introduces a deduction for expenditures on qualified hazardous fuel reduction activities, certified by fire management agencies. The law defines these activities and improvements and specifies effective dates for the changes.
